title: Mozambique: Labour Minister Pledges Support for Ex-Miners' Association
text:
South Africa: Anderson Looks Ahead to Djokovic at Wimbledon 
During the meeting, the association said they need improved seeds, and also a machine to clean the maize before it is milled. 
Diogo replied “the government will continue to support this association and the population of Mambadine so that people can continue working and producing food. This means fighting against poverty”. 
The association has already received a variety of support from the government, and Diogo was checking on how this aid has been used on the ground. She seemed satisfied, since she promised that, later this year, the machine they requested for cleaning the maize before it is turned into flour will be obtained. 
Diogo also announced that the Massinga district government has a plan to drill 25 boreholes, one of which will be in Mambadine. The district government will also provide farmers with improved seeds. 
Later on Thursday Diogo visited the Inhamussua Agricultural Institute, in Homoine district, where she was briefed on professional training projects for young people aged between 17 and 29, in areas that include metalwork, agricultural processing and sewing and dressmaking. 
The Minister encouraged the trainees to work hard in order to set themselves up as self-employed artisans. In their discussions with her, some of the trainees said they wanted to join associations where they could make use of the skills they have acquired. 
Others said they wanted to set up their own businesses. Diogo praised their dynamism, and promised that the government will continue to encourage initiatives of this sort. Mozambique
